story:
This page is for the leafy seadragon design. If you would like to order one of the other four limited edition designs, click the images at the bottom of this page. 

We have been following Jo Brown's artworks since we came across her unique style of drawings several years ago. Recently we reached out to Jo with the idea of producing new artworks based on underwater photographs of our favourite ocean animals from around the world.

Jo has created five incredible concept pieces that we are hoping to print in a limited production of 25 t-shirts through this campaign. If successful, we will continue to work with Jo to think up and release new designs.

Lets share Jo's artwork with the world and show people our passion for marine life whilst we're at it. Art isn't only to be admired on gallery walls - why not wear beautiful art on a hand printed, eco-friendly T-shirt!

How are the shirts eco friendly?

We've found a supplier of organic cotton T-shirts (free of plastic micro-fibres) produced using responsible social practices and renewable energy. The 'Earth Positive' T-shirts will be hand screen printed in Bristol, UK and shipped directly to you using as little plastic packaging as we can. 

How do I make sure that  I get the right size and colour?

At the end of the campaign we'll send you a survey asking for which cut (M/F), colour and size combination you would like. We will then send them out. 

Why run an Indiegogo campaign for T-shirts - why not do a bulk print and sell them individually?

Consumer clothing produces an incredible amount of waste, some of which ends up in our oceans. The global average consumption of textiles is around 13kg per person, per year. Along the production chain there can be negative effects from agricultural practices, emissions of chemicals and plastic micro-fibres, and poor working conditions in factories. It sounds unthinkable, but a large portion of the budget fashion produced every year never ends up being worn before it enters landfill.

10,000 discarded clothing items in Hugh’s War on Waste;

Derick Melander's artwork Tollens (2017).

We want to ensure that any T-shirts we get made have as positive an impact on the people and environment as possible. For this to work, we need them all to go on to a happy new owner, with none left unworn or discarded as 'fashion waste'. When they can be worn no longer we hope they can be donated, mended, up-cycled, or composted rather than discarded into landfill. This campaign can help us make this happen - and if you've read this and become a supporter, it's already working!

What if you get more than 25 T-shirt orders? Will you run out?

No, we won't run out - we won't take your money or print the shirts if we don't get 25 orders, but we would love to print more. If you're a supporter and we make or exceed our goal, you won't miss out on a shirt.

Where will our money go?

Most of the funding will go towards actually purchasing and printing the T-shirts, since this is a minimum run. About 30% of each shirt sale will go towards collaborating on the next set of commissioned artworks with Jo Brown.

If we exceed our initial goal of funding 25 shirts, the cost of printing begins to decrease. If we get more than 25 orders, we'll donate 2.5% of the proceeds to Oceana, a charity which campaigns for global Ocean Conservation at a community level. If we pass 100 shirts we will increase this to 5%; at 150 shirts, 7.5%; for 200 shirts, 10%, and so on to a maximum of 20% of the overall funding.

The shirts look awesome, I want to support the campaign, what size should I order?

Here's the sizing guide direct from the t-shirt supplier. Please note that due to the small print run and screen-printing method, the size of the printed artwork will not scale to the size of the shirt.

Mens/unisex sizing guide:

 Ladies cut sizing guide:

 

Click here to view the cuttlefish t-shirt campaign

Click here to view the humpback whale t-shirt campaign

Click here to view the octopus t-shirt campaign

Click here to view the mantis shrimp t-shirt campaign

story:
LIFE Connection is much more than just a fashion brand, it is a lifestyle. We want to make every sale make the world a better place.

 

 

Our products are designed to have a positive impact on the environment. We will achieve that not only by using sustainable and recycled materials but also by donating 10% of every sale to different private organizations once the project gets funded. 

Each model has a display design inspired in each of the causes we will support once the project is funded, these causes are Clean Oceans, Reforestation, Health and Education. 

Our watches are carefully designed to have the most comfortable ergonomics without compromising its everyday roughness.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Environmentally friendly shipping service

We want to make every sale make the world a better place.  Our products are designed to have a positive impact on the environment. We will achieve that not only by using sustainable and recycled materials but also by donating 10% of every sale to different private organizations once the project gets funded. Each model has a display design inspired in each of the causes we will support once the project is funded, these causes are Clean Oceans, Reforestation, Health and Education. Our watches are carefully designed to have the most comfortable ergonomics without compromising its everyday roughness.      Environmentally friendly shipping service

story:
-The Bison and Bison 2 dimensions: 5 1/2"H x 4"W x 1/2"D (closed). A single layer of leather is approximately 1/16" thick, 5/6 oz. leather. Each card pocket can hold 4 credit cards comfortably.

-The Dillon dimensions: 4 3/16"W x 3"H x 7/16"D. A single layer of leather is approximately 1/16" thick, 4/5 oz. leather. Each card pocket can hold 3 credit cards comfortably.

-Key FOB dimensions: Leather strap is 3 1/4"L x 3/4"W (can fit up to 2" width, such as a belt), Brass clasp is 2 1/4"H x 3/4"W. A single layer of leather is approximately 1/16" thick, 9/10 oz. leather.

-Key chain dimensions: Leather strap is 2 1/2"L x 3/4"W, Brass ring is 2/16" thick x 1 4/16" diameter, Brass clasp is 2 1/4"H x 3/4"W. A single layer of leather is approximately 1/16" thick, 9/10 oz. leather.

-Swivel clasps and key rings are antique brass (solid brass), rivets are solid copper, and thread (stitching) is waxed polyester thread. 

-Scroll through our photos to see information on our leather suppliers, both are American tanneries.

-We get our hardware and our thread from American companies, located on the East coast.

-Shipping will be done with USPS, and shipping in the U.S.A. is free.

Our key keepers are great for anyone. The key chain clasp easily grabs onto belt loops, purse straps, and more. The FOB strap easily opens to attach to a belt, bag strap, and more.

The Dillon in vegetable tanned leather. The tan is hand dyed saddle tan, and the brown is hand dyed dark brown.

Our Dillon wallet is perfect for the minimalist or when you just want to travel lightly.

The Dillon is a perfect fit for your front pocket.

The Bison and Bison 2 (the 2 on the left are Horween Chromexcel, the other 3 are veg tan).

The Bison and Bison 2 can pack 'em in while staying slim.

The Bison in veg tan leather (hand dyed saddle tan). This wallet can hold at least 12 credit cards and the back cash pocket can hold multiple bills.

The Bison 2 in veg tan leather (hand dyed dark brown). This wallet can hold at least 8 credit cards, 1 passport or small notebook, and the back cash pocket can hold multiple bills.

The Bison fits nicely in the back pocket. Depending on the pants, it may fit in your front pocket, too.

Behind the Business

We are a husband (Mike) and wife (Chandra) team that are natives of Colorado. We love this state so much, that we named our business after it (Colorado means Colored Red in Spanish). Our business started out with the Mrs. making bracelets, in the summer of 2015. She wanted a creative outlet, as well as the ability to offer quality goods at an affordable price. This quickly turned into us working together, and we shifted our focus to leather goods that are suitable for various styles and various ages.

The Bison Bifold was created out of Mike's desire to have a wallet that can house multiple cards and cash, while not becoming bulky. The Bison fits that need perfectly, and is a great alternative to the bifold of yesteryear. It can house 16 credit cards and several bills, while maintaining a slimmer thickness than many other bifold wallets. We then were able to design the Bison 2, which allows you to keep your passport safely tucked away with your cards and cash. 

The Dillon minimalist wallet was born out of Chandra's need to have a way to carry the minimum, of necessities, when on the go with our 2, young daughters. The Dillon serves just that purpose. She is able to take a few cards, a few bills, and just go. No need to always carry a big wallet, or a bag to hold the wallet in. The Dillon is a great fit in the front pocket, back pocket, and shirt pockets.

In this day in age, the majority of goods are mass produced and of poor quality. That is why each one of our pieces are hand cut, hand assembled, hand stitched, hand finished, and, in some cases, hand dyed. Along with making each piece by hand, we only use high quality materials to ensure your leather goods will last. We are passionate about what we do, and thoroughly enjoy making each piece.

Our website: Colored Red Leather Goods

Our Etsy Shop: Colored Red

Follow Us on: Instagram and Facebook

What you're backing

As our business steadily grows, we are looking to add to our tool and material inventories. Some of these tools can get expensive, but are worth every penny. With your help, we will be able to get some tools. Below you will find one of the items we would like to get, with your backing.

MT900 Multifunction Foot Press- $920 This will help us save time on production. 

Risks & Challenges

We have been in business for just a little over a year and a half, and have tried various suppliers and various materials. So we have an understanding of what to expect from the suppliers that we consistently use and trust.

The only potential risk, for us not meeting a deadline, is an issue with the delivery of a material. An example of an issue, is a delay in shipment. We want you to know that you will receive your item(s), regardless of any setbacks we may encounter. We will provide clear and constant communication, so that all backers are aware of any changes.

We set our delivery dates the way we did, so that we can have a little extra time to obtain our needed materials, should any delays occur with them. By setting our delivery dates this way, hopefully you can avoid receiving your item(s) later than expected. You may actually get your item(s) sooner than what is listed.

Helping

Not everyone can financially contribute, and we completely understand. If you are only able to spread the word for us, that's plenty of help.

Materials

-We only hand stitch (saddle stitch method) with waxed polyester thread, from Maine, USA. The thread colors available, on here, are black, bark tan, natural, and chestnut. Thread (stitching) colors will match the leather (as shown in photos). We offer more thread colors, on our website, but limited it to four colors, on here, to help with production time. 

-Vegetable tanned (veg tan) leather is available in natural, tan (hand dyed saddle tan), or brown (hand dyed dark brown). We get our veg tan leather from Hermann Oak Leather. They are an American tannery that has been around for over 120 years. The raw materials used in the old style "vegetable tannage" process are primarily organic in nature. They use almost no pigment (paint) finishes. At most, their leathers will have a wax finish.You can click on their name that is highlighted, to read more about them.

-Horween Chromexcel leather is available in natural or black. We get our Horween leather from Horween. They are an American tannery that has been around for over 100 years. Through the years, they have cultivated their experience to offer dynamic lines of leathers. Their products include traditional, old world tannages and techniques, carefully updated with modern applications.You can click on their name that is highlighted, to read more about them.

By setting our delivery dates this way, hopefully you can avoid receiving your item(s) later than expected. You may actually get your item(s) sooner than what is listed.

Helping
Not everyone can financially contribute, and we completely understand. If you are only able to spread the word for us, that's plenty of help.
Materials

-We only hand stitch (saddle stitch method) with waxed polyester thread, from Maine, USA. The thread colors available, on here, are black, bark tan, natural, and chestnut. Thread (stitching) colors will match the leather (as shown in photos). We offer more thread colors, on our website, but limited it to four colors, on here, to help with production time. 

-Vegetable tanned (veg tan) leather is available in natural, tan (hand dyed saddle tan), or brown (hand dyed dark brown). We get our veg tan leather from Hermann Oak Leather. They are an American tannery that has been around for over 120 years. The raw materials used in the old style "vegetable tannage" process are primarily organic in nature. They use almost no pigment (paint) finishes. At most, their leathers will have a wax finish.You can click on their name that is highlighted, to read more about them.

-Horween Chromexcel leather is available in natural or black. We get our Horween leather from Horween. They are an American tannery that has been around for over 100 years. Through the years, they have cultivated their experience to offer dynamic lines of leathers. Their products include traditional, old world tannages and techniques, carefully updated with modern applications.You can click on their name that is highlighted, to read more about them.

story:
Short Summary - shop for a cause!

Imagine a magical online shop where you can buy shirts, bags, socks and more and every time you buy an item the money goes to help grassroots projects in cities in conflict. Not only that but the incredible items you are buying are designed by artists, designers and illustrators local to the cities we are helping. But wait, there's more! All the items will be sustainable and have organic, circular and renewable goals in mind during the manufacturing process. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £2500 to make our dream to build peace and community in divided societies through the FCT shop a reality. 

What you get:

- £25 - shoutout on social media 

- £50 - a tote bag 

- £100 - an FCT-shirt 

- £1000 - An FCT-shirt, a tote bag, and we will livestream a party for you on our Instagram

The Impact

The FCT Network Fund (a brand name of Foundation NI) supports a dynamic network of people living in extreme circumstances and fragile political environments who wish to build a better and more peaceful future. 

We wish to involve local artists, designers and illustrators from these cities to produce FCT-shirts, FCTbags and other FCTwear in order to sell in our FCTshop. These profits will then go to grassroots projects in cities in conflict. FCT Cities include:

- Derry / London-Derry (The Derry Model)

- Jerusalem, Israel (The Women's Hub, Mini Active, Atta'a Centre and Good Neighbors)

- Kaduna, Nigeria (The Peace Pitch Project)

- Kirkuk, Iraq (INSAN Project)

- Tripoli, Lebanon (Social Innovation Hub)

 

Risks and Challenges

We are a small team of passionate volunteers and we are only just starting to build the FCT shop but we will keep you updated every step of the way. From finding our designers, to sourcing our sustainable manufacturing partners and finally producing the shop on our website: https://www.fctnetworkfund.com/. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute but there are so many other ways you can help:

- Join our FCT Ambassador Program 

- Share this campaign using Indegogo's sharing tools to your Facebook, Instagram or Twitter account to help us get the word out

- Follow our progress on Instagram @forumforcitiesintransition

Thank you so much for all of your support from all of us at FCT Network Fund and cities in conflict around the world <3

story:
Stainless Steel - White/Black Dial

Keeping the design uncomplicated yet elegant ensures the test of time. 

 The subtle angles of the characteristic sides finish the sophisticated look we wanted. 

Macro lens shot of the characteristic sides.

The polished markers are hand-applied on ceramic dial with a window for the date function.

*Note - Some images may contain of previous prototype with a Miyota cal.9015 movement.*

The selected automatic movement is the ETA 2824-2, one of the top movements from ETA SA Manufacture Horlogère Suisse.  

The rotor will have custom design in gold PVD coating.

Image of first prototype with Miyota cal. 9015

Introduced in 1961, the ETA 2824 traces its roots to the Eterna 1427 design. The ETA 2824-2 is the second generation that has been in production since 1982. Being one of the most recognized movement in the watch industry tell it's quality and durability. 

It is a date complication movement that beats at 28.800 bph, giving the second hand a sweeping second motion. With impressive 38-40 hours power reserve and 25 jewels. The high grade mechanical movement's slim trait makes it perfect for our minimalistic watch. 

Visible heart through the clear case back with the movement from previous prototype, Miyota cal. 9015

A wristwatch isn't complete without the straps/bracelets. The organically tanned full-grain leather is from here in Sweden. In addition, the leather gets a naturally fine patina over time. 

The metal bracelets are made with high quality 316L stainless steel to endure the test of time and give you the premium feel on the wrist. 

Upon delivery will backers receive their watch in a watch box for storage when the watch isn’t used. Size depends on which pledge you get. 

Send us an Email to hello@lindskogsweden.com or write a comment in the comment section of our Kickstarter campaign page. If you like, visit our social media pages or our website to find out more.

story:
We relied on three key requirements for the product, while creating BRIETHER for you:  

- BRIETHER is the durable high-quality product. We used the best materials and highest requirements for the sewing quality  

- Cross functional, timeless design, which combines classic elegance and modern urban style  

- Functionality and user-friendliness. That's all that modern man needs

 

 We created timeless design of this bag so you could use this bag in various life situations.

 

BRIETHER has four main colors:

 All you need is in your hand.

 

 Olifant Design DOESN’T USE genuine leather in its products. We used PU material in BRIETHER.

 PU material is a modern water-repellent material, which has all the best properties of genuine leather:  

• pleasant to touch (warm, soft, stretchy)  

• vapor-permeable («breathing»)  

• wear-proof, durable  

• has a high tenacity and doesn’t tear apart at the seams even when it’s intensively stretched  

• classic design that is resistant to the passage of time  

• doesn’t emit harmful substances

 We use water resistantse zip YKK "Aquaguard".

Interior lining, which we use, is made of Microfibre – this material makes the product more esthetic and light.

Here's a detailed outline of our actual production planning.  

September & October 2018: Select partners.  

- Final selection of manufacturers, suppliers, and logistics providers.  

- Extensive pre-production testing.  

- Order materials & components.  

November & December 2018: Make & Ship.  

- Start production run (the production run takes around 30 days).  

- Quality control and packing.  

- Ship.  

January 2019: Delivery.  

- Briether is delivered to customers.

There won’t be a classical photo of a team of five people. Big team of professionals and people, who contributed their experience and energy to the creation of the best product for you, worked on this bag. However, we would want to tell you about Polina – the mastermind of this project.

story:
ABOUT

Sarsen derives its unique view from the experiences of the designer, Heather Ellrod.  Growing up in Seattle has helped create her dark aesthetic message; an edgy and mysterious interpretation of her alternative roots.  After a decade in the retail industry Heather pursued her dream of creating her own collection.

Sarsen is a collection that is sleek, simple, and stark- impossible to avoid.  It is inspired by clean shapes with elegant lines.  The range of garments varies from impeccably tailored coats and jackets to uniquely designed dresses and tops.  The constant throughout the collection is the sultry mystery that is evoked from each piece.  

This Fall will debut my first collection and I need your help funding production!  Without your support I won't be able to produce these styles I have been working on for the last year.  So take a look at the gallery, if you see anything you like, please pre-order it from the list to the right!  If we meet the goal I will be able to produce your order!

Website: www.shopsarsen.com

Facebook:http://www.facebook.com/pages/Sarsen/168362159917420

NEEDS

To produce the Fall line I need to make $26,000.  Each style costs approx. $3,000 to produce.  This includes:

  • buying fabric for each style
  • cutting each style 
  • sewing each unit
  • grading each style to produce sizes
  • taxes, you know how it is!  
  • this will produce 25 units of each style that I can then sell to the market and you!

If this end goal is not met no money will be kept from any contributor!  It also means you don't get your super awesome life changing perks!  This is why making this goal is so important!

Any contributions exceeding the goal will go to:

  • marketing the brand and products
  • photoshoots, fashion shows, and events
  • SPRING LINE!

 

IMPACT

With your orders and contributions you will be producing an exciting, edgy, small apparel line from an exciting, edgy, and not so affluent designer trying to start her own business and be her own boss!

The line is already participating in Bellevue Fashion Week (which was mentioned in September VOGUE 2012) and the Raw Artists Provocations show in October.  The line hasn't even debuted yet!  There is a promising future for SARSEN if I can get it on it's feet!

 

PERKS (MOST IMPORTANT OBVIOUSLY)

If you contribute not only will you be thrown good juju for life you will get perks ranging from small (but extremely important) thank yous from me, free admission to upcoming fashion shows and events, and styles from the Fall line.  If your favorite number is $12 or you just won $4,336 and want to make a charitable donation, that works too!  Just click on the CONTRIBUTE NOW button!

 

OTHER WAYS

Can't contribute?  That's ok, I still love you and I still need your help!

  • Use the Indiegogo tools to spread the word to others
  • Post on your Facebook, Twitter, or release homing pigeons about my campaign
  • Talk about it at your hair appointment, family dinner, or during break room gossip, any exposure is good exposure!
  • Donate time if you are a model, photographer, or videographer

story:
Two size of trainers!


11" x 13" Modular Board

 7" x  9" Modular Board

 Standard module exploded view

 Base with power connector explode view

HOW IT'S WORK

The base has the power connectors for the circuits modules, the spacers and the 3mm parker bolts.

 Choose the needed power supply for your project from the modules alternative. (5V, 3,3V, etc) and plug into the base with four bolts

 and keep plugging all the modules you need.....

On this picture we have a 40 pin Pic controller, Alpha Numeric Lcd, Basic Stamp, Power Supply, Analog Signal, Digital Outputs with led and TTL to RS-232 converter.

 If you need more funtions or circuit to your projets, JUST GO 3D!

And place the modules on top!

Like xbee, wifi, relay boards, etc...

 OR MAYBE YOU WANT ANOTHER LCD TOUCH SCREEN, LIKE THIS 

The big board (11" x  13") has a lot more space for modules and a breadboard holder at the center.

 And you can go 3D too...

 This is a upper view of the modular boards

 Here is some circuits modules of the board family

There are 3 modules sizes, 2"x 2", 2"x 3" and 3"x 4"

3"x 4" Family, ULCD-32PTU, Alpha Numeric LCD with Outputs Button

2"x 3" Family, 40 pin Pic board, Basic Stamp, Atmega, Inverter, Digital Inputs, 28 Pic board, 18 pin Pic board, Ethernet to RS-232 Converter, Custom board for your owns circuits and more.

2"x 2" Family, Dual Triac board, Dual Scr Board, Relays, Touch Screen Controller, RTC Real Time Clock, Xbee, Keyboard, Digital Potenciometer, Usb Plug, 3,3V Power Source, 5V Power Source, 5-6-9V Power Source, I2C Memory, Tone Decoder, BCD Digit Display, ULN2408, Zero Cross Detector, 18 Pin Pic Board, 8Pin Pic Board, Usb to Serial Converter, Analog Output, Wifi to Serial Converter, TTL to Serial Converter, LDR Sensor, Gas Sensor, Motion Sensor, PIR, Digital Output Display with Leds, GPS Module, Voltmeter, Anmeter, Custom Board for you own circuit and more!

story:
By contributing to the campaign, you can be one of the first people to get your own Elka Synthex reissue – at a significantly lower price than what they'll retail for. Backing us is low-risk: if you don't love your Elka, you can return it within 14 days – and if we don't for some reason meet our target, we will refund your money in full.





The legendary Elka Synthex synthesiser is making a comeback in 2015. Originally produced from 1981 to 1985, only a small number of this iconic synthesiser were ever made. Now it's making a comeback – and you can make it happen. 

The Elka Synthex has an incredible sound that’s landed it a spot in the synthesiser hall of fame – one of only forty instruments in the world. It’s sound can be heard on some of the 20th century’s best-loved albums. And now you can make it yours.



The Elka Synthex is a polyphonic synthesiser that is capable of eight-note polyphony. In order to achieve this, the Elka Synthex comes with eight monophonic synthesiser circuits – all vintage parts. 


The Elka Synthex is completely programmable, enabling you to save sounds you’ve created for future use. A wide array of pre-sets are also supplied with the instrument, making this one of the most versatile vintage synths out there. 

The reissued Elka Synthex synthesisers will be hand-built in Salo, Finland, using a combination of vintage and new components. This way we can ensure that the reissue has that signature Elka sound and user interface that Elka fans love, while making use of technological advances that improve its efficiency.

The Elka Synthex had an original design that stood out from anything that had come before it.  This will be true of the reissue as well: the reissued Elka Synthex comes with the original user interface design, including the iconic joystick controller, ensuring that all controls are within easy reach.



The Elka Synthex is one of the most sought-after synthesisers out there. With careful sound design and innovative build, it’s a true musical instrument that’s stood the test of time. And today, it sounds as fresh as it did in 1981.

  • Jean-Michel Jarre still owns three working Synthexes which he uses to this day both in the studio and live on tour. They have been used on every new album since Rendezvous in 1985 – the album on which the iconic use of Synthex with the laser harp first was heard.
  • Keith Emerson's famous GX-1 Fanfare For The Common Man sound was recreated on the Synthex, and he bought one to use live for that piece and other songs on the 1985 World tour with ELP.
  • Synthex was on Stevie Wonder's Characters album and on the Skeletons hit single. Wonder ordered the final machine left in stock at Elka, and picked it up on his 1986 European tour. He used it to replace his ailing GX-1 and live on his 1987 world tour.
  • The Synthex appears on the soundtrack of the movie Die Hard in the track playing in the limousine scene by Stevie Wonder.
  • When Asia keyboard player Geoff Downes (ex-Buggles, ex-Yes) bought a Synthex and used it extensively on the 3rd Asia album in 1983, singer/bass player John Wetton (ex-King Crimson, Ex-Roxy Music) liked the sound of it so much he bought one as well and used it for many years on his solo albums.
  • When Geoff Downes produced the Steve Howe/Steve Hackett supergroup GTR's album, there was no keyboard player on the album but all the strings, brass and synth parts were triggered on the Synthex via MIDI guitar by ex-Genesis guitarist Steve Hackett. Ex-Yes/Asia guitarist Steve Howe also triggered several lead sounds on the Synthex via MIDI guitar.

Support the Elka comeback crowd-funding campaign on Indiegogo and get your hands on some cool merchandise as well as the first reissued Elka Synthex synthesisers – hot off the presses and with a lower-than-retail price tag.

Love the Elka? Give us a shoutout with the hashtag #BringElkaBack on Twitter and Instagram.

Let’s make it happen!

Pre-order the Elka Synthex for a special early bird price –  up to 30% lower than the estimated retail price. This is only available during the Indiegogo campaign and all the money will go into the production, so hop to it! 

Perk #1: Elka Synthex Pre-order for Early Birds ($ 3181)

This perk includes the ELKA Synthex with the special early bird price. Act fast!

Perk #2: The Elka Synthex Pre-order ($ 3315)

This perk includes the ELKA Synthex.

Perk #3: The ELKA Synthex Distributor 3-Pack Pre-order  ($ 8740)

This perk includes 3 ELKA Synthexes with a special distributor discount.

Goal #1 – If 250 Elka Synthexes are sold: Elka Synthex keyboard stand for all pre-orderers

Once we reach the first goal, every ELKA Synthex pre-order will be upgraded to include the legendary keyboard stand. 

Goal #2 – If 375 Elka Synthexes are sold: Elka Synthex flight case for all pre-orderers

Once we reach the second goal, every Elka Synthex pre-order will be upgraded to include a flight case in which you can carry and store your brand-new-vintage synth.

We love the Elka Synthex – and think that you will, too. By supporting us you will help us start the reissue of these vintage gems. And the Elka is just the first of our planned products.

We’re an independent small business. We plan on building products with integrity and with soul. And we think you’ll fall in love with the Elka Synthex.


The money will be used to kick-start the production in Salo, Finland. So your money will be going directly into the making of the Elka Synthex, plain and simple.


We are Soundion Oy Ltd., the Finnish instrument manufacturer which acquired Generalmusic, which includes the Elka and GEM brands. 

Soundion Oy Ltd was founded by Jukka Kulmala in Salo, Finland. The Elka Synthex will be our first product – and one of many to come. We’ll specialise in synthesisers, electronic keyboard instruments and sound equipment.

Jukka Kulmala



Jukka Kulmala is the CEO of Soundion Oy and a long-time musical instrument professional and electronic music buff. Kulmala has a background in banking and music company management, with extensive knowledge of business finance.

During his extensive career, he has worked at Ensio Music – a record company and music publisher – as the Managing Director, as well as at Fazer Musiikki in Turku as a Managing Director. Kulmala also has extensive experience in finance, where he worked as a Corporate Banking Manager for Nordea between 1983 and 2010. 


Seppo Nikkilä

Seppo Ilmari Nikkilä, M.Sc.EE, born 1949, graduated from Helsinki University of Technology mastering in Digital Electronics and Computer Science in 1975. In the early 1970s he was pioneering the use of microprocessors in industrial control. In 1980 he lead a group that employed the emerging local area networking technology with microprocessors to design and implement an integrated process and production automation system – still in use worldwide. 

In 1975  Nikkilä co-founded Genelec Oy, a Finnish audio technology company specialising in active monitor loudspeakers. Since 1988 he has worked as the CEO for ANT – Advanced Network Technologies Oy, and since 2003 especially with the wireless distribution and collection of real-time, streaming multichannel high definition audio. Nikkilä is AES member number 83990 and the author of nearly one hundred scientific or technical papers and reports.

Paul Wiffen


Paul Wiffen, Product Specialist and Sound Designer, M.A. (Hons) OXON, has had an extensive career in sound design, music production, composition and electronic music. Wiffen is the original sound designer of the Elka Synthex – and his sounds will be heard on the reissued Synthex as well.

Wiffen has worked extensively with the likes of Jean-Michel Jarre, Stevie Wonder, Geoff Downes, Keith Emerson and Paul McCartney. His sounds were used by Emu, Ensoniq, Sequential, Akai, Roland and Yamaha – but he always had the Synthex in the boot of his car as samplers by themselves could often not deliver the power and depth of sounds on which his reputation was based. 

Wiffen went on to found Digital Village, the number one retailer in the UK of digital audio on computers that was recently sold to the German retail giant Music Store, and has worked with Apple as a music and audio evangelist. Wiffen’s more recent work has been in film: he won the 24hr film challenge in Cannes in 2006 and his docudramas have won three international awards on Mexico, Ireland and Long Island in the US.


Download the full tech specs here.

1. Why is this marked as flexible funding? Will you refund my money if you don't reach your target?

The campaign is being run like a fixed funding campaign, and the page got mistakenly marked as "flexible funding" during the setup. Unfortunately changing the page at this stage isn't technically possible, but we will refund your contribution 100% should we not meet our goal.

To find out more about fixed funding and refunds, read more here.  We understand that you're considering contributing a lot of money to this project, and want you to know exactly what you're agreeing to. If you have any other questions or concerns about this, don't hesitate to drop us a line at lets@bringelkaback.com.


2. Why are you bringing Elka back? Why not create something new?

The Elka Synthex has long been loved and missed by both musicians and enthusiasts alike. Originally produced between 1981 and 1984, its iconic eightnote polyphony sound defined a generation of music across genres, from the pure electronica of Jean–Michel Jarre, through the stadium rock of Asia and Duran Duran, to the urban funk of Stevie Wonder. In reissuing this coveted instrument, Soundion wants to provide Elka Synthex aficionados around the world with a new opportunity to own one of these timeless classics at a fair price. 

This is the world’s first crowd­funding campaign to reissue a vintage instrument no longer in production.

3. How will the new Elka Synthex be manufactured?

We are ramping up a world-class production environment in Salo, Finland. This will provide all reissued Elka Synthexes with the highest possible build quality. Soundion Oy acquired all the intellectual property and assets of Generalmusic – including Elka. Along with the acquisition of the company came warehouses full of original vintage components that will be used in building the reissued Synthexes. These will be combined with newly manufactured components as required and assembled manually to give a current Elka Synthex the sound of the original.

4. Will the technical specs of the reissued ELKA Synthex differ from the original?

Stock of the original CEM3320 filter chips are available. However, before making the final decision to use any vintage parts, we must verify the parts can last another 30 years. The same logic applies for other components as well. We're working on this now and will provide updates on specific components as we go.
5. How can I follow the remake of the ELKA Synthex?
There’s a lot happening and you can follow the development of your ELKA Synthex as the story unfolds. Stay up to date on this page, and we definitely recommend following us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for the latest news and bits from the Soundion HQ.


6. In what countries will the ELKA Synthex be available? 

Worldwide, pretty much! If you've got concerns about shipping to your country of residence, get in touch with us.

7. Are shipping costs included in the Perk price in Indiegogo?
Shipping costs are not included in the pre-order perk price, and will be charged later before we ship your Elka Synthex to you. We will inform you with delivery options closer to the delivery date. We'll do our very best to make sure you get the Elka Synthex delivered flexibly and at a good price.

8. Does the Perk price include VAT or other taxes?
The perk price does not include taxes and duties payable in your country of residence, and they will need to be paid by the contributor separately. Once we get closer to the delivery date, we'll ask you to confirm your shipping address.

If you live in the EU, we will also provide instructions on how to do the VAT payments.

Outside the EU, you will have to handle the customs and taxes on your own.

9. When are you going to ship me my ELKA Synthex?

We aim to ship the first ELKA Synthex synthesisers in December 2015. Please note that the delivery date is subject to change. We will keep you updated on the schedule in our update emails.

10. If I am not happy with my new ELKA Synthex, can I return it and get my money back?

Yes, you may return the ELKA Synthex delivered to you within 14 days of receiving it. Please note that the refund return shipping, including any customs or other charges – as applicable – will be borne by the sender.

11. After the Indiegogo campaign, where will the ELKA Synthex be available? 

We are currently working on the distributor network. At the moment we do not have any plans to share, but once everything is set we'll let you know. 

Didn't find the answer to your question? Send us an email at lets (at) bringelkaback.com. We're happy to help!
story_txt:
By contributing to the campaign, you can be one of the first people to get your own Elka Synthex reissue – at a significantly lower price than what they'll retail for. Backing us is low-risk: if you don't love your Elka, you can return it within 14 days – and if we don't for some reason meet our target, we will refund your money in full.

The legendary Elka Synthex synthesiser is making a comeback in 2015. Originally produced from 1981 to 1985, only a small number of this iconic synthesiser were ever made. Now it's making a comeback – and you can make it happen. 
The Elka Synthex has an incredible sound that’s landed it a spot in the synthesiser hall of fame – one of only forty instruments in the world. It’s sound can be heard on some of the 20th century’s best-loved albums. And now you can make it yours.







The Elka Synthex is a polyphonic synthesiser that is capable of eight-note polyphony. In order to achieve this, the Elka Synthex comes with eight monophonic synthesiser circuits – all vintage parts. 
The Elka Synthex is completely programmable, enabling you to save sounds you’ve created for future use. A wide array of pre-sets are also supplied with the instrument, making this one of the most versatile vintage synths out there. 








The reissued Elka Synthex synthesisers will be hand-built in Salo, Finland, using a combination of vintage and new components. This way we can ensure that the reissue has that signature Elka sound and user interface that Elka fans love, while making use of technological advances that improve its efficiency.


The Elka Synthex had an original design that stood out from anything that had come before it.  This will be true of the reissue as well: the reissued Elka Synthex comes with the original user interface design, including the iconic joystick controller, ensuring that all controls are within easy reach.

The Elka Synthex is one of the most sought-after synthesisers out there. With careful sound design and innovative build, it’s a true musical instrument that’s stood the test of time. And today, it sounds as fresh as it did in 1981.
Jean-Michel Jarre still owns three working Synthexes which he uses to this day both in the studio and live on tour. They have been used on every new album since Rendezvous in 1985 – the album on which the iconic use of Synthex with the laser harp first was heard.

Keith Emerson's famous GX-1 Fanfare For The Common Man sound was recreated on the Synthex, and he bought one to use live for that piece and other songs on the 1985 World tour with ELP.

Synthex was on Stevie Wonder's Characters album and on the Skeletons hit single. Wonder ordered the final machine left in stock at Elka, and picked it up on his 1986 European tour. He used it to replace his ailing GX-1 and live on his 1987 world tour.
The Synthex appears on the soundtrack of the movie Die Hard in the track playing in the limousine scene by Stevie Wonder.
When Asia keyboard player Geoff Downes (ex-Buggles, ex-Yes) bought a Synthex and used it extensively on the 3rd Asia album in 1983, singer/bass player John Wetton (ex-King Crimson, Ex-Roxy Music) liked the sound of it so much he bought one as well and used it for many years on his solo albums.
When Geoff Downes produced the Steve Howe/Steve Hackett supergroup GTR's album, there was no keyboard player on the album but all the strings, brass and synth parts were triggered on the Synthex via MIDI guitar by ex-Genesis guitarist Steve Hackett. Ex-Yes/Asia guitarist Steve Howe also triggered several lead sounds on the Synthex via MIDI guitar.



Support the Elka comeback crowd-funding campaign on Indiegogo and get your hands on some cool merchandise as well as the first reissued Elka Synthex synthesisers – hot off the presses and with a lower-than-retail price tag.
Love the Elka? Give us a shoutout with the hashtag #BringElkaBack on Twitter and Instagram.
Let’s make it happen!


Pre-order the Elka Synthex for a special early bird price –  up to 30% lower than the estimated retail price. This is only available during the Indiegogo campaign and all the money will go into the production, so hop to it! 
Perk #1: Elka Synthex Pre-order for Early Birds ($ 3181)This perk includes the ELKA Synthex with the special early bird price. Act fast!Perk #2: The Elka Synthex Pre-order ($ 3315)This perk includes the ELKA Synthex.Perk #3: The ELKA Synthex Distributor 3-Pack Pre-order  ($ 8740)
This perk includes 3 ELKA Synthexes with a special distributor discount.

Goal #1 – If 250 Elka Synthexes are sold: Elka Synthex keyboard stand for all pre-orderersOnce we reach the first goal, every ELKA Synthex pre-order will be upgraded to include the legendary keyboard stand. 
Goal #2 – If 375 Elka Synthexes are sold: Elka Synthex flight case for all pre-orderers
Once we reach the second goal, every Elka Synthex pre-order will be upgraded to include a flight case in which you can carry and store your brand-new-vintage synth.
We love the Elka Synthex – and think that you will, too. By supporting us you will help us start the reissue of these vintage gems. And the Elka is just the first of our planned products.
We’re an independent small business. We plan on building products with integrity and with soul. And we think you’ll fall in love with the Elka Synthex.
The money will be used to kick-start the production in Salo, Finland. So your money will be going directly into the making of the Elka Synthex, plain and simple.







We are Soundion Oy Ltd., the Finnish instrument
manufacturer which acquired Generalmusic, which includes the Elka and GEM brands. 



Soundion Oy Ltd was founded by Jukka Kulmala in Salo, Finland. The Elka Synthex will be our first product – and one of many to come. We’ll specialise in synthesisers, electronic keyboard instruments and sound equipment.

Jukka Kulmala



Jukka Kulmala is the CEO of Soundion Oy and a long-time musical instrument professional and electronic music buff. Kulmala has a background in banking and music company management, with extensive knowledge of business finance.
During his extensive career, he has worked at Ensio Music – a record company and music publisher – as the Managing Director, as well as at Fazer Musiikki in Turku as a Managing Director. Kulmala also has extensive experience in finance, where he worked as a Corporate Banking Manager for Nordea between 1983 and 2010. 
Seppo NikkiläSeppo Ilmari Nikkilä, M.Sc.EE, born 1949, graduated from Helsinki University of Technology mastering in Digital Electronics and Computer Science in 1975. In the early 1970s he was pioneering the use of microprocessors in industrial control. In 1980 he lead a group that employed the emerging local area networking technology with microprocessors to design and implement an integrated process and production automation system – still in use worldwide. 
In 1975  Nikkilä co-founded Genelec Oy, a Finnish audio technology company specialising in active monitor loudspeakers. Since 1988 he has worked as the CEO for ANT – Advanced Network Technologies Oy, and since 2003 especially with the wireless distribution and collection of real-time, streaming multichannel high definition audio. Nikkilä is AES member number 83990 and the author of nearly one hundred scientific or technical papers and reports.
Paul Wiffen


Paul Wiffen, Product Specialist and Sound Designer, M.A. (Hons) OXON, has had an extensive career in sound design, music production, composition and electronic music. Wiffen is the original sound designer of the Elka Synthex – and his sounds will be heard on the reissued Synthex as well.
Wiffen has worked extensively with the likes of Jean-Michel Jarre, Stevie Wonder, Geoff Downes, Keith Emerson and Paul McCartney. His sounds were used by Emu, Ensoniq, Sequential, Akai, Roland and Yamaha – but he always had the Synthex in the boot of his car as samplers by themselves could often not deliver the power and depth of sounds on which his reputation was based. 
Wiffen went on to found Digital Village, the number one retailer in the UK of digital audio on computers that was recently sold to the German retail giant Music Store, and has worked with Apple as a music and audio evangelist. Wiffen’s more recent work has been in film: he won the 24hr film challenge in Cannes in 2006 and his docudramas have won three international awards on Mexico, Ireland and Long Island in the US.














Download the full tech specs here.

story:
GOAL BREAKING NEWS:  I'm so happy to announce I produced the initial batch of American-Made Dress Project dresses and delivered ahead of schedule. 

This campaign is now post-production, but you can still show support. Perks have been updated to offer a limited number of remaining dresses that can be yours! I've got them here in my workshop, so they're a sure thing—I'd love to send you one!

—Betsy Cook
   National Picnic Designer and project creator

Photos from production:

Above: Fabric arrives from North Carolina, content tags from New York, and me standing by the cut pieces to be sewn into dresses. The first batch of dresses has been completed and some have already been shipped to early supporters.

The Little Dress That Could

So here goes...this dress isn't rocket science. It certainly won't track your pulse or do anything gimmicky. It’s a casual dress that fits great, feels super-soft and looks awesome on. People like rooting for my little independent brand, and prefer the extra quality and care that goes into the goods. Isn't that enough? 

Let me give you a little back story.

The dress (3rd from right) in a recent fall collection. This was taken at a model fitting for Philadelphia's Old City Fest Fashion Show.

I'm a clothing manufacturer. National Picnic, my clothing brand, has been around for over five years, and I have a following of loyal fans. I began sewing these particular dresses only last winter, from sweatshirt fabric remnants. The pattern is my own design—I cut the pieces myself and sewed them almost entirely by myself. I share a "locally-made" boutique in Philadelphia with other designers, and the dress was sold there.

The response to this dress was surprising. Women loved them! They bought them as fast as I could produce them! 

This season, I found myself making them again, as fast as I could.  I needed to find a way to keep this dress moving without taking ALL of my time and energy making them. I juggle owning the whole business! I have to design new things for next season! I needed help, and that need launched my idea.

How I made this simple dress even more SPECIAL

"Special” needed to go beyond look, feel and fit to make it crowdfunding-worthy.  So I set out to make this dress, that I already know is popular, as American-made as possible. For good measure, even more sustainable attributes were worked in.

I found a company that makes sweatshirt fabric (from organic cotton no less) in North Carolina. I've met more than a couple contractors in Pennsylvania (and elsewhere) and have visited their factories. With their involvement, this particular dress, sewn domestically, with USA-milled fabric, spreads more dollars around the american-owned business to business community, and affects a wider circle of employment in several regions of the United States. 

Why didn’t I just work with these businesses in the first place? These wonderful businesses require MINIMUM ORDERS. I need to order so many yards of fabric to have it made for me, and order so many of one dress style to be sewn.

100 dresses was the original goal—so between a little rounding, and offering some additional reward levels, a goal was set.

Don't wear dresses, but want to root for me? The  $25 perk is a nifty USA-made bottle opener keychain with my brand's label stitched to the wrist fob.

The Little Dress That Could. I think I can do it. I know I can do it. The extent of one dress's impact on my career and the economy is about to be tested. Won’t you follow this journey with me?

Betsy Cook
Owner/Designer/Bottlewasher, National Picnic Clothing

DRESS DETAILS:

These photos are actual fabric and dresses from the project. The model is 5'9"—the average wearer is shorter and the hem will appear closer to the knee.

Fit: Dress has a loose fit and structured drape, like a shift. Falls to above the knee on average-height women. Sleeves are intended to be rolled to show contrasting fleece, they can be rolled to a wider or narrower cuff to hit at the wrist or further up the arm. Hem has a shirttail shape (curved to hang lower in the center front and back, shorter on the sides), the length at center back neck to hem is 36".

National Picnic measurement guide:

XS: Bust 33-34, Waist 26-28, Hip 36-37 
S: Bust 35-36, Waist 28-30, Hip 38-39 
M: Bust 37-38, Waist 30-33, Hip 40-42 
L: Bust 40-42, Waist 33-36, Hip 43-44 
XL: Bust 43-44, Waist 37-39, Hip 45-46

Dress details:

Rolled sleeve cuffs, ribbed neckline

New and improved: Please note that a new "2.0" neckline features a ribbed trim and a reinforced center back inside. (Earlier customers in the video are wearing first generation dresses, with a different neckline material) 

More dress views.

Content: Eco-friendly organic cotton recycled poly blend, sourced from a North Carolina fabric company. The gray outer layer is 50/50 organic cotton/recycled poly, and the interior is super-soft 100% organic cotton. This fabric most closely resembles the original fabric used, and has excellent low-shrinkage performance. Ribbed neck trim is 100% cotton, of existing surplus stock from my workshop.

Color: Choose from light or dark heather gray with contrasting natural white backing. 

Care: Machine wash cold or warm. Air dry for best care; alternately, you may tumble dry on low heat. Shrinkage is appx. 2%, within standard market expectations for natural fibers.

Sizes offered: S-XL. 

THANK YOU!

Your support means so much to me. Please follow National Picnic on Instagram, Facebook, and Pinterest for continued updates about my clothing-maker journey.

Risks and challenges

The exact fabric couldn't be sampled prior to campaign, so prototypes in video and photos represent a close but not exact match to final fabric.  

Returns and exchanges

Exchange for a different dress size within 30 days of delivery will be honored when requested, it's good business!

I'll work with you to find a desirable equal value product exchange. Do realize that because crowdfunding is about project backing, you won't be able to return a dress reward to get your money back. This is a risk you should consider. If you would like the ability to return for money refund, please check out my website instead (nationalpicnic.com), to shop my other awesome and readily available clothing styles.

story:
FastButton® to sew button without a needle, thread, scissors or thimble

 

 

How it works

FastButton® works like a nylon tie: it slips through from under the fabric, it passes through the button holes and it locks into its small plate hidden beneath the fabric.

 

1 - Insert FastButton® pointed end into the fabric, inside-out, through the button holes. Then push the needle back into the fabric.

2 - Insert the toothed thread in the central hole of the small plate and pull, until FastButton® fits together with the fabric.

3 - Cut off the remaining part of the thread and the needle. Done!

 

 

Technical features
 

FastButton® to always be well dressed

This idea came out during my experience in the Italian Army, when I realized to have lost a shank button of my uniform few minutes before a miltary parade. At that time I used a small cable tie (for Electrician) and, thanks god, it worked perfectly!

Few years ago I heard aboud the 3D model and I tried to make my first prototype. After that I obtained my first Patent for FastButton®

 

The FastButton's needs

  • I need to fund few mould modifications, and buy a new component to improve how the machine works. To my sponsor I will send FastButton® for the very cheap price of 60 $cents each.
  • There are few option to make the "Crystal Transparent" one. We are looking for the best solution for the product reliability and the production efficiency.

The Impact

My vision about FastButton® is to find it for free when I buy a new clothes as the spare buttons they already use to provide with any kind of clothes.

So please, even if you can't fund me, just use the share tools for this campaign to make your life easier with the falling buttons in future!
story_txt:
FastButton® to sew button without a needle, thread, scissors or thimble
 

 
How it works
FastButton® works like a nylon tie: it slips through from under the fabric, it passes through the button holes and it locks into its small plate hidden beneath the fabric.

 
1 - Insert FastButton® pointed end into the fabric, inside-out, through the button holes. Then push the needle back into the fabric.

2 - Insert the toothed thread in the central hole of the small plate and pull, until FastButton® fits together with the fabric.
3 - Cut off the remaining part of the thread and the needle. Done!
 

 
Technical features 




FastButton® to always be well dressed
This idea came out during my experience in the Italian Army, when I realized to have lost a shank button of my uniform few minutes before a miltary parade. At that time I used a small cable tie (for Electrician) and, thanks god, it worked perfectly!
Few years ago I heard aboud the 3D model and I tried to make my first prototype. After that I obtained my first Patent for FastButton®

 
The FastButton's needs

I need to fund few mould modifications, and buy a new component to improve how the machine works. To my sponsor I will send FastButton® for the very cheap price of 60 $cents each.
There are few option to make the "Crystal Transparent" one. We are looking for the best solution for the product reliability and the production efficiency.


The Impact

My vision about FastButton® is to find it for free when I buy a new clothes as the spare buttons they already use to provide with any kind of clothes.
So please, even if you can't fund me, just use the share tools for this campaign to make your life easier with the falling buttons in future!

story:
After one year of research, development, and testing, we are finally ready to present our most versatile and comfortable shirt yet: Limitless Milk Shirt - the world's first and only shirt made from upcycled milk.

Mi Terro is on a global mission. As the weather gets hotter, you need to wear something cooler. Our timeless classics are crafted to ensure you can look your best, do your best and be your best. A highly functional shirt for travel, outdoors, and every day that can be worn more and washed less. 

 

What makes the Limitless Milk Shirt so innovative?

The Limitless Milk Shirt is odor-free, anti-bacterial, unbelievably soft, moisture-wicking, wrinkle-resistant, temperature regulating, and stretches in every direction to move with your body. It is truly the one shirt you can wear day in and day out, no matter the weather, occasion, or location.

 

Meticulously crafted from the yarn up to combine high performance with shirt comfort, this one-of-the-kind shirt replaces at least four shirts in your bag. The Limitless Milk Shirt is the perfect shirt for work, outdoors, travel and every day.

THREE TIMES SOFTER THAN COTTON

Our breathable milk shirts are three times smoother and softer than cotton while allowing it to be just snug enough to be perfectly form-fitting. We wanted to make sure that you can actually feel that silk texture tucked against your body. Unlike cotton shirts that are thick and bulky, the Limitless Milk Shirts are light and breathable.

SKIN PROTECTION

We've created a fabric that enhances the capabilities of your skin; keeping you warm when it’s cold and cooling you down when it’s warm. At the same time helping your body control micro bacterial growth and kill the unwanted bacteria. With this line of basics, we've focused on the three most important pieces of shirts that will help stay fresh, clean and odorless.

SKIN PROTECTION

We've created a fabric that enhances the capabilities of your skin; keeping you warm when it’s cold and cooling you down when it’s warm. At the same time helping your body control micro bacterial growth and kill the unwanted bacteria. With this line of basics, we've focused on the three most important pieces of shirts that will help stay fresh, clean and odorless.

SEAMLESS STITCHING

From the fabrics that we create, down to the stitches and seams, we've focused on the details so you don't have to. We opted for premium threads reserved only for the most luxurious apparel for a completely itch-free experience. These shirts will make you feel like you're wearing nothing.

When we set out to build a shirt as dynamic as your daily life, we knew we had to start with the fabric. We thought shirts deserved an upgrade so we built ours from the ground up, starting with our super soft milk fabric. 

According to Ecosalon, milk fibers contain 20 amino acids that are beneficial to health. The amino acids in the protein have actually been found to be anti-bacterial and anti-aging and can help regulate blood circulation and body temperature. Good news for conscious shoppers looking for clothes that do double duty. 

Milk feels soft like a feather but lasts longer. It's the Stretch Armstrong of the fabric world. After repeated washes, it remains absorbent, soft and supple compared to normal cotton, and retains its shape for longer!

To make the shirts even more comfortable and breathable, we blended milk with micromodal, another environmental-friendly fiber made from beechwood tree. 

This special fiber is constructed into a unique knit fabric to enhance its performance and give you the ultimate range of movement and style. The knit creates a honeycomb structure, which provides a nice texture to the fabric while lifting it off the skin, further enhancing the temperature regulation of the milk. Its construction provides extensive multi-direction stretch to move with your body.

Milk, Micromodal, and Elastane. The perfect blend for a perfect shirt. Made from recycled beechwood, Micromodal produces no harmful byproducts and significantly less waste than other fibers. The manufacture of modal uses 20% less water. and 10% less land is needed to grow micromodal. Milk supplies durability, comfort, softness and moisture management. 

Due to its glossy and rich texture, milk fabric has been widely used as an alternative to silk since its invention.

FREE US SHIPPING OVER $100, FOR A LIMITED TIME

The Amazing Add-on

Because of the comforts and softness of our fabric, we decided to create underwear from it. It is the first and last underwear that you will ever want to wear. 

The Stitching & Mesh: Our craftsmen hand-stitch every pair of boxer briefs under precise guidelines and methods to ensure high-quality, durable underwear.

Reinforced Cross Stitching

Durable Stitching for Waistband & Main Fabric

The Fit: Since milk fabric adapts to your body type, there will never be any tightness or discomfort. Carefully designed with the masculine body in mind, our underwear is custom made just for you.

Profiles your body type 

Avoids riding up for all-day comfort

Silky pouch for your privates

Hand-tailored measurements and specifications

International Backers

All international shipments are subject to duties, taxes and clearing fees which you are responsible for paying. Most countries will assess duties/taxes on your package and in certain countries, the carrier will pre-pay the duties and taxes and bill you later.

Risks and challenges

Mi Terro Global is a professional business. Quality products and happy customers are what we do. We are not perfect but we never stop until we get it right. 
This is our second Kickstarter project. We have always delivered and have always been transparent with our backers about our progress and challenges. With our experience, we have together with our production team done our best to create a realistic projection of the time necessary to manufacture and deliver rewards. Complications can arise while manufacturing at such a high standard.

story:
Partner Name/Founder Name— Md Jobayer Hossain Name — Service bee

Overview

(Just one or two lines for each section, this is the overview)

Vision: The grand vision [e.g. to be the leader in affordable interplanetary cargo transport]

Problem: General problem [$Xbn direct+indirect cost of all interplanetary cargo transport] + the specific problem you are solving [Specifically, moon to mars cargo transport for housing of first-inhabitants has $Xbn direct costs for the U.S. government]

Product: Exactly how you solve it, don’t mention features or details [e.g. don’t transport cargo, place 3D printers on each planet and transport material]

Founders: Brief intro of founders [e.g. 2 of the founders are straight out of college (tier 1 university, no work experience). One founder worked at Big_Company for 4 years]

Early Hires: Quality of the hires [4 person team with 3.5 years avg. work experience in relevant companies to their roles. Team composition lacks some essential talent like material scientists and sales]

Market: TAM and market drivers/challenges [$Xbn annual TAM. Market driven by increasing global warming threat on earth. Long-term, Human-on-a-chips (HoaC) decreasing the demand]

Business: revenue, metrics, traction summary. [Z% gross margins, $Xm Average Revenue Per User (ARPU). Pilots with N companies, $Xk ARR last year]

Deal: Round size, previous VCs. [$Xm series A. Previous investors not reputable. Not a fit for OurVC. Total investment (our portion) in this and following rounds expected to be total $Ym to maintain a 20% ownership]

Risk Analysis/Expected Return/Probability Weighted Return on Investment (PWROI): r [=9]

More on this at the end of this document. The image below is work of Clint Korver of Ulu Ventures..................................

story:
Our story

Hello, my name is Eduardo Martins, I'm Portuguese, born in Angola 52 years ago, I live near Lisbon, in the city of Montijo, on the left bank of the Tagus River. I'm married, father of three daughters and grandfather of two grandchildren. Professionally I work in graphic design and photography but my interests are vast, ranging from drawing to comics and sculpture and literature to history. MK I Field Watch started as a design project about three years ago. Soon it proved to be a real challenge and the more I deepened my knowledge of the history of watchmaking, the more serious it became. After dozens of drawings and the exploration of some concepts - and after several watches bought and dissected - I realized that military watches were the ones that fascinated me the most, both for their heritage and their simplicity. That was when the idea of creating a watch brand dedicated to resistant and utilitarian watches was born, as I no longer wanted to design a watch but a series of them! Thus CONTAR was born.

The Portuguese word "contar" has several meanings, it means both calculating and narrating, as it is also used to say about something or someone that is reliable. As, in some way, we want to tell stories but also reflect the very history of military watchmaking with the watches we are going to produce, as we agree there is a long record of field and military watches and our models will always reflect this heritage, as it isn't only aesthetics but rather based on the strength of simplicity and effectiveness. Contar seemed appropriate and was approved by the most demanding assembly of all: my family.

In the future we want to create a collection of watches in some way linked to military events, we want to tell stories and produce watches that establish a link to the past. We have several ideas and projects under development, maybe the Great War, where we Portuguese also played a role, but we also love marine watches. Let's see what the future holds.

As we agree there is a long record of field and military watches and our models will always reflect this heritage, as it isn't only aesthetics but rather based on the strength of simplicity and effectiveness​.

Eduardo Martins

 

What We Need & What You Get

Creating a brand is not as simple as it may seem, it is arduous because it takes us away from the creative process and requires a lot of dedication - here I must emphasize the support of those who are closest to me, they have been decisive in this journey - which at times is very lonely - also motivating greater responsibility and commitment. I believe that for any independent brand financing is a fundamental issue. A new brand without any background in the business makes the challenge greater. This is where Indiegogo and its contributors come in. We invested in the legalization of CONTAR, in the development of the first model, in the search for the right manufacturer, in molds and prototypes, the packaging, our website, in promotional materials on social networks, and in many other things. But the biggest slice concerns the manufacture of the watch. At this moment when we launch this campaign everything is finished and the manufacturer is waiting the order to start mass production.

The value we want to achieve is intended to make the production of the MKI feasible and make it reach our backers within the promised time. 

 

The Impact

Your support will also allow us to continue the development of the next watch and continue to build a true collection of quartz and mechanical watches.

MK I is, therefore, our scout, we send him forward, he will tell us what lies ahead on the road.

 

Watch Specifications:

Case Material: 316L Stainless Steel
Brushed Finish
Case Size: 40mm 
47mm lug to lug
Case Thickness: 10,5 mm (including crystal)
Lug Width: 20mm
Dial: black with applied markers and printed arabic numerals
Movement: VD78 Japan Movement
Water Resistance: 10 ATM (100M)
Lume: BGW9
Crown: 7mm Screw down, engraved with CONTAR logo
Case Back: 4 Screws with recessed area for strap accommodation
Crystal: Double domed sapphire 
Anti-reflective inside coated
Straps: Olive green nylon double pass with signed buckle.

 

Some notes

The CONTAR field is mainly inspired by British military watches from World War II and other more recent ones like the MK XI with a dial design of the RAF's own responsibility. In our model we merged some of these designs and made sure to use a layout with small seconds, which limited our movement options a little. The VD78, in addition to being from a reliable manufacturer, was the one with the longest pinion distance and we wanted the second sub dial to be as large as possible, without sacrificing 5 and 7 arabic numerals. The 24-hour military scale was in doubt but still useful and accentuates the military character of the watch.

The case was supposed to have drilled lugs but this would reduce the distance between the springbars and the case which would make it difficult to place thicker straps. This is a watch designed to be used with "Nato" or "Zulu" straps that expose the springbars, facilitating their removal and placement.

We did not want to use patina, this is a new watch that will age naturally, so we opted for the BGW9 Lume which maintains a white appearance. By opting for applied markers, we believe we can facilitate relume in the future.

Unlike the first prototype, the applied stainless steel markers will have a matte finish, similar to the hands.  And the triangular marker at 12 o'clock will also be applied.

 

The applied markers are useful to help reading time in certain light conditions. The matte finish makes it easier to read but without shiny sparkles.

Caseback recessed area for strap accommodation. The watch fits more comfortably on the wrist.

 

VD78  is a reliable Japanese quartz movement. The accuracy of the movement is 20 seconds a month, with about 3 years of battery life (SR626SW).

 

Screw down crown. Aid to water resistance (10 ATM) of the watch and protects the crown.

 

 

BGW9 Lume in hands and applied markers.

 

Olive green double pass nylon strap, with signed buckle.

 

Risks & Challenges

We have established a good relationship with our manufacturers and suppliers, so we do not foresee any problems, but if they do you have our guarantee that we will resolve them quickly and transparently and share everything we consider relevant to those who support us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can support spreading this campaign in your social media contacts, You may use the Indiegogo share tools!  That would mean a lot to us.

story:
Why you need this?  

Before getting to know about Maze wallet , we would like to ask you a question.Do you find your pockets insanely bulky with keys, wallet, earphone, coins... etc ?

If yes , you must have a Maze wallet.

What is Maze ?

Maze/Maze+ is a minimal wallet with timeless style. Made with high quality water repellent fabric.  

Maze/Maze+ can tidily store your cards, banknotes, keys, coins and whatever small items that you are carrying.  

Maze/Maze+ is layered with RFID protection material which can stop large range of frequency used in credit cards and smart cards, hence, protecting you from wireless theft.

The smart design of elastic ribbon surface comes with great functionality. You can store all your mini stuff with these ribbons.  

Elastic ribbon surface holds various items such as USB, earphone, memory cards etc , by the elastic ribbon suface.

Maze - extra card slot with no RFID Blocking.

Maze+ - holds at maximum 4 keys.

 

Easy access pull tab for cards and bill notes.

 

Holds at maximum 7 cards without stretching out.

Made of water repellent fabric.

 

Color Selection( Red, Green, Blue, Yellow )

 

Our Story  

Plol Design aims to create products which improve your daily life with designs at an affordable price for all users. We believe a successful product is not only judged by the material, but also the functionality of your needs. 

How we make use for your supports?  

Your funding will be used in :

  • Production Cost  
  • Shipping Cost  
  • **Marketing Cost - expanding our network like joining exhibitions, different marketing schemes, etc., to bring Maze/Maze+ and upcoming designs worldwide.  

We can't succeed without YOU.  

 

A Big Thanks To You!  

A very big thanks to each backers. We will be grateful if you share Maze/Maze+ with your friends, just click the links below!  

For media, distributors or retailers wishing additional information, please send an email to ploldesigns@gmail.com

Risks and Challenges

We aim to bring good product at a reasonable price for all you all. The only challenge for us is the shipping cost , as our products will be manufactured in Hong Kong and to be sent worldwide. 
We have full control over the production process and delivery procedures will be conducted to avoid empty promise to our backers.

Your every support counts!
story_txt:
Why you need this?  Before getting to know about Maze wallet , we would like to ask you a question.Do you find your pockets insanely bulky with keys, wallet, earphone, coins... etc ?If yes , you must have a Maze wallet.What is Maze ?Maze/Maze+ is a minimal wallet with timeless style. Made with high quality water repellent fabric.  Maze/Maze+ can tidily store your cards, banknotes, keys, coins and whatever small items that you are carrying.  Maze/Maze+ is layered with RFID protection material which can stop large range of frequency used in credit cards and smart cards, hence, protecting you from wireless theft.The smart design of elastic ribbon surface comes with great functionality. You can store all your mini stuff with these ribbons.  Elastic ribbon surface holds various items such as USB, earphone, memory cards etc , by the elastic ribbon suface.Maze - extra card slot with no RFID Blocking.Maze+ - holds at maximum 4 keys. Easy access pull tab for cards and bill notes. Holds at maximum 7 cards without stretching out.Made of water repellent fabric. Color Selection( Red, Green, Blue, Yellow ) Our Story  Plol Design aims to create products which improve your daily life with designs at an affordable price for all users. We believe a successful product is not only judged by the material, but also the functionality of your needs. How we make use for your supports?  Your funding will be used in :
Production Cost  
Shipping Cost  
**Marketing Cost - expanding our network like joining exhibitions, different marketing schemes, etc., to bring Maze/Maze+ and upcoming designs worldwide.  
We can't succeed without YOU.   A Big Thanks To You!  A very big thanks to each backers. We will be grateful if you share Maze/Maze+ with your friends, just click the links below!  For media, distributors or retailers wishing additional information, please send an email to ploldesigns@gmail.comRisks and ChallengesWe aim to bring good product at a reasonable price for all you all. The only challenge for us is the shipping cost , as our products will be manufactured in Hong Kong and to be sent worldwide. We have full control over the production process and delivery procedures will be conducted to avoid empty promise to our backers.Your every support counts!

story:
Eldon Watches are dedicated to the men who live fast paced lives. To the men who go from one opportunity to the next. To the men who seek to be extraordinary. Eldon recognises this, by building a watch that can be as adaptive as you. You’re in charge, we just facilitate.

 

Our Vision – We're a young and vibrant British company made up of passionate people and we want to change the way watches are perceived and used.  

Our Mission – to facilitate the extraordinary, by developing the highest quality, most adaptive fully interchangeable watches in the world.

Our first Eldon Watch was born from the revolutionary idea that a watch should be created by the wearer. You shouldn’t accept anything other than exceptional. That’s when the fully interchangeable watch came to life.

The Eldon Watch design was created to be one of a kind. The case shape is made to stand out whatever occasion. The face designs express quality, adventure and exclusivity. At the heart of each watch is a highly accurate Swiss Quartz Movement.

We have partnered with a leading manufacturer with more than 25 years of timepiece manufacturing and assembly experience to ensure the highest quality for our watches.  

We make use of high-tech CNC-machining for the production of the watch case to ensure the most precise and accurate dimensions. Our components are hand-finished to a high standard to ensure the personal attention and touch when it comes to the mechanics of our watches.

Eldon insist upon a high standard - every component that enters the manufacturing process and goes into your watch is controlled down to the finest detail, ensuring that its dimensions, aesthetics and quality are flawless. 

For this reason, we offer a 12 Month Guarantee on all Cases, Faces and Bezels. We also offer a 6 Month Guarantee on all straps.

#
